Summary: Assess sample representativeness and also try reweighting... 

```{r}
## library packages
library(here)
source(here("code", "helpers.R"))

### read in dmf 
dmf <- fread(here("data", "censoc_dmf_clean.csv"))

## read in 1940 census 
census_1940 <- fread("~/workspace/data/P.tsv", select = c("HISTID", "SERIALP", "AGE", "INCWAGE", "SEX", "EDUC", "RACE", "RELATE", "MARST", "SEI")) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()

## read in 1940 census household
census_1940_h <- fread("~/workspace/data/H.tsv", select = c("SERIAL", "STATEFIP", "OWNERSHP", "URBAN", "REGION")) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()
```

## Link data 

```{r}
## combine census person and household vars 
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940 %>% 
  inner_join(census_1940_h, by = c("serialp" = "serial"))

census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  filter(sex == 1)

## add on dmf  
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  left_join(dmf %>% filter(byear %in% 1890:1905), by = "histid")

## recode education variable to years of education
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  recode_education(educ_var = "educ")
```

## Recode variables 

```{r}
## recode variables 
census_1940_hh_vars <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  mutate(race = race.x) %>% 
  filter(age %in% c(32:50)) %>% 
  mutate(match_conservative = case_when(
    link_abe_exact_conservative == 1 ~ "Matched",
    TRUE ~ "Unmatched"
  ),
  match_standard = case_when(
    link_abe_exact_conservative %in% c(0, 1) ~ "Matched",
    TRUE ~ "Unmatched"
  ), 
  hs = case_when(
    educ >= 60 & educ < 998 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ), 
  rural = case_when(
    urban == 1 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  black = case_when( 
    race == 200 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ), 
  white = case_when(
    race == 100 ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  homeown = case_when(
    ownershp == 10 ~ 1, 
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  p_hh_head = case_when(
    relate == 101 ~ 1, 
    TRUE ~ 0
  ),
  Education = case_when(
    educ <= 50 ~ "No high school",
    educ %in% 60:90 ~ "High school or some college",
    educ %in% 100:116 ~ "Bachelors degree or more",
  ), 
  SES = case_when(
    sei %in% 1:12 ~ "Low SES",
    sei %in% 12:25 ~ "Medium SES",
    sei >= 26 ~      "High SES"
  ),
  Marriage = case_when(
      marst %in% 1:2 ~ "Ever married",
      TRUE ~ "Never married" ),
  Race = case_when(
    race == 100 ~ "White",
    race == 200 ~ "Black",
    TRUE ~ "Other"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(Rural = case_when(
    rural == 1 ~ "Rural",
    TRUE ~ "Urban"
  ),
  Home = case_when(
    homeown == 1 ~ "Homeowner",
    TRUE ~ "Renter"
  ),
  Region = as_factor(region)) %>% 
   mutate(link_abe_exact_standard = case_when(
    link_abe_exact_conservative %in% c(0, 1) ~ 1,
    TRUE ~ 0
  ))

```



```{r}
## tabulations for men in 1940 census 
census_characteristics <- census_1940_hh_vars %>%     
 select(histid, Education, SES, Marriage, Region, Rural, Home, Race) %>%
  pivot_longer(-c(histid, Race)) %>% 
  group_by(name, value, Race) %>%
  tally() %>%    
  group_by(Race, name) %>% 
  mutate(prop = round(100*prop.table(n), 1)) %>% 
  rename(n_gen = n, prop_gen = prop)

## tabulations for men in CenSoc-DMF conservative 
dmf_characteristics_conservative <- census_1940_hh_vars %>% 
  filter(link_abe_exact_conservative == 1) %>% 
  select(histid, Education, SES, Marriage, Region, Rural, Home, Race) %>%
  pivot_longer(-c(histid, Race)) %>% 
  group_by(name, value, Race) %>%
  tally() %>%    
  group_by(Race, name) %>% 
  mutate(prop = round(100*prop.table(n), 1)) %>% 
  rename(n_gen_conservative = n, prop_conservative = prop)
```


```{r}
combined_characteristics <- census_characteristics %>% 
  inner_join(dmf_characteristics_conservative, by = c("name", "value", "Race")) %>% 
  mutate(name = as.factor(name), value = as.factor(value)) %>% 
  mutate(name = factor(name, levels = c("Education", "Marriage", "Home", "SES", "Rural", "Region"))) %>% 
  arrange(name, value) %>% 
   filter(name != "Region") %>% 
  filter(!is.na(value)) %>% 
  mutate(value = factor(value, levels = c("No high school",
                                          "High school or some college",
                                          "Bachelors degree or more",
                                          "Homeowner",
                                          "Renter",
                                          "Other",
                                          "Ever married",
                                          "Never married",
                                          "Low SES",
                                          "Medium SES",
                                           "High SES",
                                           "Rural",
                                           "Urban")))
```

```{r}
rep_plot <- combined_characteristics %>% 
  filter(Race != "Other") %>% 
           ggplot() +
   geom_segment(aes(xend=prop_conservative, x=prop_gen, y=value, yend=value),
        #       arrow = ggplot2::arrow(length = unit(0.1, "cm")),
               color='black', 
               alpha=0.5) +
  geom_point(size = 1.5, aes(x = prop_gen, y=value, color='1940 Census')) +
  geom_point(size = 1.5, aes(x = prop_conservative, y=value, color='Censoc-DMF')) +
  facet_grid(name ~ Race, scales='free_y', space='free_y', switch='y') +
  labs(x = "Fraction of sample") +
  scale_color_manual(name = "", values = c("1940 Census" = "black", 'Censoc-DMF' = "red")) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(scale = 1)) + 
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position=c(.915, .945),
        legend.direction='vertical',
        legend.margin=margin(t=0, unit='cm'),
        legend.box.background = element_rect(colour = "black"),
        legend.title=element_blank()) 

ggsave(rep_plot, filename = here("figures/appendix_representativeness_plot.png"), height = 6, width = 9)
```


```{r}
## tabulations for men in 1940 census 
census_characteristics <- census_1940_hh_vars %>%     
 select(histid, Education, SES, Marriage, Region, Rural, Home, Race) %>%
  pivot_longer(-c(histid, Race)) %>% 
  group_by(name, value, Race) %>%
  tally() %>%    
  group_by(Race, name) %>% 
  mutate(proportion = prop.table(n))

## get around 
marginals_round <- census_characteristics %>% 
  mutate(variable = name, level = value) %>% 
  # mutate(proportion = case_when(
  #   variable != "region_string" ~ round(prop_gen/100, 3),
  #   TRUE ~ round(prop_gen/100, 4))) %>% 
  filter(variable %in% c("Education", "Home", "Marriage", "Region", "Rural", "SES"))

## create weights 
dmf_sibs_black <- autumn::harvest(data = census_1940_hh_vars %>% filter(!is.na(byear)) %>% filter(Race == "Black"), target = marginals_round %>% filter(Race == "Black")) 

## create weights 
dmf_sibs_white <- autumn::harvest(data = census_1940_hh_vars %>% filter(!is.na(byear)) %>% filter(Race == "White"), target = marginals_round %>% filter(Race == "White")) 

## dmf weights 
dmf_clean_weights <- dmf_sibs_black %>% 
  bind_rows(dmf_sibs_white) %>% 
  mutate(weight_1940_census = weights) %>% 
    select(histid, weight, weight_conservative, byear, dyear, death_age, race = race.y, link_abe_exact_conservative, byeardiff_census_minus_dmf, bpl, census_age, weight_nchs, weight_1940_census)


fwrite(dmf_clean_weights, here("data", "censoc_dmf_clean.csv"))
```
